metadata.feature_description: Wiki functionality within DNN social groups with group-specific content

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test Group > Wiki tab
steps.expected: Wiki tab should be displayed with Create article option
steps.actual: Wiki tab displayed with 'Create article for front page...' and existing articles list
Create article dialog opened with Title, Article Type, Content, and Tags fields

steps.action: Fill form with Title='Group Integration Test Article', Type='Misc.', Content, Tags
steps.actual: Form filled successfully, required fields populated

steps.action: Encounter validation error for content field
steps.actual: Initial validation error 'Text is required' appeared due to contenteditable editor behavior

steps.action: Add content properly and click Publish
steps.expected: Article should be created and published
steps.actual: Article created successfully, redirected to article page

issues: Content editor validation requires actual keyboard input to register content - 'Text is required' error appeared even with visible content until keyboard interaction triggered

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test Group > Wiki tab to view articles list
steps.expected: List should show articles created in this group
steps.actual: Wiki tab shows '2 Articles' count with both 'Group Integration Test Article' and 'Group Wiki Test Article' listed

steps.expected: Articles should show title, last updated, summary, and tags
steps.actual: Articles displayed with full details: title, 'Last updated: X minutes/weeks ago', content preview, 'View Full Page' link, and Tags

steps.action: View article detail page as group owner
steps.expected: Edit, Delete, History options should be available
steps.actual: Article page shows Edit button, Delete link, History link, Like/Bookmark/Unsubscribe options, and Report link

steps.action: Click Edit to verify edit access
steps.expected: Edit dialog should open allowing modifications
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened with all fields editable: Title, Content, Tags, Approved checkbox, and Advanced section

steps.action: Create article in group and check for notifications
steps.expected: Notifications should be generated for wiki activities
steps.actual: Notification appeared: 'Wiki - Congratulations! You have earned a new Privilege - Edit article metadata'
Notifications tab shows 'Wiki' notification with full details and '1 minute ago' timestamp

steps.expected: Gamification badges should be awarded for wiki activity
steps.actual: Badge notification appeared: 'Congratulations! You have earned a new Badge - Wikichievement'

steps.action: Navigate to group Activity tab after creating article
steps.expected: Wiki article creation should appear in activity stream
steps.actual: Activity stream shows 'Anonymous authored wiki article Group Integration Test Article' with '1 minute ago' timestamp

steps.expected: Entry should include article link and summary
steps.actual: Activity entry includes clickable article title link, content preview, and Like/Read More/Comment options

steps.action: Open article Edit dialog to find move option
steps.expected: Option to move article to different group should exist
steps.actual: Edit dialog shows Common and Advanced sections but no option to move article to a different group

steps.action: Check Advanced section for move functionality
steps.expected: Advanced settings might contain group/move options
steps.actual: Advanced section only contains 'Article Summary' field - no move or group transfer option exists

issues: Feature does not exist - No UI option to move articles between groups. Articles remain associated with their original GroupId with no transfer functionality.

steps.action: Access group Edit settings to check privacy options
steps.expected: Group should have public/private accessibility settings
steps.actual: Edit Group dialog shows 'Group Accessibility' section with Public (selected) and Private radio buttons

steps.expected: Private option should restrict access to members only
steps.actual: Private option states: 'Only group members and those who have been invited will be able to view the group page'

observations: Code review confirmed GroupId is stored with each article (ArticleController.cs:219) and used for filtering (ListController.cs:44-47, 76)
Permission checking uses RequireGroupModeViewPermission and RequireGroupModeChangePermission functions in ContentController.cs and ListController.cs
FilterMode enum supports Normal(0) and Group(1) modes for wiki display
Journal integration works correctly - article creation posts to group activity stream via Journal.Instance.AddWikiToJournal (ArticleController.cs:257)
Subscription functionality exists for group wikis (ListController.cs:92-121)
No UI exists to move articles between groups - GroupId is set at creation and cannot be changed through the interface
Content editor uses contenteditable which requires actual keyboard input to trigger validation - may cause confusion when content appears visible but validation fails
